cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. May 1942.SECRET. Copy No. 44W.M. (12)67th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 67 (42).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Tuesday, May 26. 1942, at 1 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. C. H. Attlee, M.P., The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,Secretary of State for Dominion j K.C., M.P., Lord Privy Seal.Affairs.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson, j The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,M.P., Lord President of the Council, j Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.IThe Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton, j The Right Horn Ernest Bevin, M.P.,M.P., Minister of Production. Minister of Labour and Nationali Service.The following were also present:The Right Hon. Viscount Cranborne,Secretary of State for the Colonies.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.The Hon. Sir Alexander Cadogan,Permanent Under-Secretary of Statefor Foreign Affairs.Sir Edward Bridges, Secretary.U.S.S.R. The War Cabinet had a discussion, which is recorded in the(Previous Secretary's Standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.Bef erence:W.M. (42) 66thConclusions.)Great George Street, S. W. 1,May 26, 1942.[23875-1]
